title: Standard Form
text: The standard form of a quadratic is as follows: $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$

title: Finding h
text: We can find h by using the formula $$\frac{-b}{2} a$$. $$\frac{-8}{4}=-2$$. $$h=-2$$

title: Finding k
text: We can substitue $$x=h$$ into the general form of the quadratic to find k. 2(-2)**2+8(-2)-10=k=-18

title: Rewriting into Standard Form
text: Using the values of a, h, and k derived in the previous steps, we can write the equation in standard form. $$f(x)={2\left(x+2\right)}^2-18$$
